sentence.text: Mutations in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II [THAP (Thanatos-associated protein) domain containing, apoptosis associated protein 1], a ubiquitously expressed transcription factor with DNA binding and protein-interaction domains, cause dystonia, DYT6.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: However, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II downstream targets in neurons, and the mechanism via which it causes dystonia are largely unknown.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
